fields.description:
This is a parent task to group all Studio logging problems.

In order to provide proactive support, we need to see problems in the application and react to them before the customer. This means monitoring the logs, currently done by sending ERROR and WARN-level logs to the administrators (AOD-611). Unfortunately there are many cases where the log level is inappropriately set, which results in a lot of noise for anyone monitoring the logs to sift through.  This issue is to track and hopefully eliminate these.

fields.description:
JIRA FishEye Plugin is very slow.  As an example:

https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/download/SFT-LOAD/artifacts/build-7/Load-Test-Report/load-test-2008-05-07.html

The JIRA Issues, JIRA dashboard and Main dashboard requests have errors because the FishEye plugin is taking too long too respond, thus taking up all the threads.

An example of a single instance of where it's slow:

1) Go to http://load1.jira.com/browse/AAC-4
2) Click on the source tab.
3) The screen takes > 10 seconds to load

This is not a FishEye or SVN performance issue:

1) Go to http://load1.jira.com/source/search/AAC
2) Enter "AAC-4" into the comment field.
3) The search returns in less than 1 second

fields.description:
Revealed in the blitz test on 01 May 2008.
Some users received null pointer exceptions when trying to delete projects.
This occurs when the project is already deleted, either from the user pressing delete twice or from multiple users trying to delete it at the same time.
The URL in the screenshot (.../secure/admin/DeleteProject.jspa) only appears in the code with an explicit "?pid=...." attached, so I suspect that the user has tried to type in the URL explicitly. (Note that this user was able to successfully delete projects at other times). 
Not specifying a pid will always result in not being able to delete a project. Now, instead of getting an ugly printout, the user will see an error message.
fields.summary: NullPointerException on project delete

fields.description:
I often find myself referencing files in Subversion. Files can be referenced with a source: prefix, but to figure out the right path requires heading off to Fisheye, finding the right URL, then deciding how much to chop off the beginning. Besides which, nobody knows about the source: prefix because nobody reads the help.

What would be nice is a separate "Fisheye file picker" widget, with its own icon. Ideally it would work like IDEA ctrl-n, letting you start typing the name of a file, and progressively narrowing the list of matches.
fields.summary: Easy way of referencing Subversion files

fields.description: Create a global favourites menu in JIRA Studio - one that contains your favourite filters, pages, review filters, code files, actions, etc etc. Allows for 2-click access to most used parts of the product. Configured by the user.
fields.summary: Global Favourites Menu

fields.description: The crowd cache timeouts aren't documented on user management pages (change groups, etc). This is necessary because it lets administrators know that their changes will not take effect immediately and that even though a change doesn't take effect instantaneously it will still take effect soon.
fields.summary: Document crowd cache timeouts on user management pages

fields.description: The plugin upgrade framework executes on the first page load for a given application.  Unfortunately, at the time the view is being rendered, there is no active transaction and therefore, Bandana throws a lot of exceptions in the logs.  We need an explicit transaction for plugin upgrade tasks and proper rollbacks if one fails.
fields.summary: Wrap plugin upgrades in a transaction

fields.description: Calls to any rest service that are wrapped by the secure wrapper that ensures the caller is an administrator need to be explicitly wrapped by a read/write transaction.  The active transaction is, by default, read-only, which will cause failure if Atlassian User tries to create property sets.
fields.summary: Wrap secure rest calls in a read/write transaction

fields.description: Users can change the SVN and FishEye targets for a project. Repo Man ignores these settings and instead uses the project key as the FishEye and SVN targets.
fields.summary: Repository Manager does not respect project FE and SVN settings

This is with the following configuration:

{noformat}
    <Location /svn>
        DAV svn
        SVNPath /data/jirastudio/svn/root

        Require valid-user
        AuthType Basic
        AuthName "Subversion Repository"

        PerlAuthzHandler Apache::CrowdAuthz
        PerlSetVar CrowdCacheEnabled On
        PerlSetVar CrowdCacheExpiry 300
        PerlSetVar CrowdAuthzSVNAccessFile /data/jirastudio/svn/root/conf/authz

        PerlAuthenHandler Apache::CrowdAuth
        PerlSetVar CrowdAppName subversion
        PerlSetVar CrowdAppPassword XXXXX
        # $$propN: test.jira.com:studio_name 
        PerlSetVar CrowdSOAPURL http://test.jira.com/crowd/services/SecurityServer
    </Location>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Crowd auth of Subversion not caching, taking too long

fields.description: In the Repository Manager groups that have read access cannot be granted commit access. A confirmed project to which this applies is the Papillon (BFLY) project.
fields.summary: Groups not added to permissions correctly.

fields.description:
Studio sends out HTML notification emails by default. [Attached|^email.html] is a sample. You'll see that there is an unreplaced token in the footer: {noformat} studio.jira.template.footer.html.edition
If you think it was sent incorrectly, contact one of this server's administrators. {noformat}
fields.summary: Broken HTML email template: footer contains "studio.jira.template.footer.html.edition"

fields.description:
Needs to be removed from all installations.

Was installed at request of Poland team, who are no longer using it. Will be replaced by availability of Green Hopper plugin.

Link to original installation ticket. https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-502
fields.summary: Remove Agile Velocity Reporting plugin

fields.description: Studio apps will occasionally need to talk to untrusted SSL services. This requires importing and trusting an SSL certificate into the local Java keystore.  As yet, we have no way to persist a keystore across VM upgrades.
fields.summary: Define mechanism for persisting a per-studio keystore
Crowd attempts to write to its crowd.properties file in the webapp

fields.description:
An old (1.3) copy of the crowd-integration-client jar is present in the 1.1 fireball:

{noformat}
$ unzip -t studio-fireball-1.1-all.zip | grep crowd-integration-client
    testing: studio-fireball-1.1/jira-webapp-3.12.3-studio-1/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-1.3.jar   OK
    testing: studio-fireball-1.1/jira-webapp-3.12.3-studio-1/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-1.3.2.jar   OK
    testing: studio-fireball-1.1/crucible-1.5.1/lib/crowd-integration-client-1.3.2.jar   OK
    testing: studio-fireball-1.1/confluence-webapp-2.7.1-studio-3/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-1.3.2.jar   OK
{noformat}
fields.summary: Duplicate jars in fireballs

fields.description: The project drop down is a little stuffed in firefox 3.0b5. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Navbar bug in Firefox 3
Upgrade Activity Streams plugins to 1.2.1

fields.description:
Currently we cannot log in to the Crowd admin console of any Studios.

In the crowd-webapp-x.x.x/WEB-INF/classes/crowd.properties we ship to Contegix, we have:

application.password=foobar

which is not correct, and won't be replaced at deployment time with the right password. We need to tokenize this and then modify build.xml so that the right password is used.
fields.summary: Password in crowd.properties not tokenized

fields.description: We should address [STRM-125|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/STRM-125], as it causes problems when importing data in a running instance.  [STRM-124|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/STRM-124] isn't critical, but can probably be done along side STRM-125.
fields.summary: Fix Stream issues STRM-124 & STRM-125

fields.description: The process of shut-down repository, post config, start repository takes too long, and can time out.
fields.summary: Fisheye Repository synching times out
